name: Waveshaper
description: This algorithm is based on the Dual Waveshaper algorithm on the disting mk4. You may like to watch the video on that algorithm here^105. From the disting mk4 manual: “Type 0 is what is usually termed a wavefolder. This increases the harmonic content of the sound in interesting ways, especially as the gain changes. “Type 1 is a triangle-to-sine waveshaper. Used on most audio this is a relatively gentle form of overdrive/saturation. However, when fed with the right level of triangle wave, the output is exactly a sine wave, which is useful when you have a triangle wave VCO handy but really want a pure sine wave instead.”

parameters.name: Input gain
parameters.description: The input gain. Negative values invert the signal.

parameters.name: Level
parameters.description: The output gain applied to the shaped signal.

parameters.name: Gain input
parameters.description: The bus to use to control the input gain. Scaled such that a 5V CV gives 32x gain.

parameters.name: Input
parameters.description: The first input bus to process.

parameters.name: Width
parameters.description: The number of busses to process, starting from the Input. For example, for a stereo signal, set this to 2.

parameters.name: Output mode
parameters.description: The standard Add/Replace mode selector as described above.
